title: Error in "Finalise Status Password Creation"
body:
# Bug Report

When installing Status Desktop, a "Login failed" error pops up once reaching "Finalise Status Password Creation" part.

## Description

I am trying to create a new account, but can not confirm the password.

## Steps to reproduce

Step1. Open installer `StatusIm-Desktop-v0.8.0-7be712` on `Microsoft Windows 11 Pro, 10.0.22621 Build 22621`.

Step2. Click `OK` as English is fine as default language.

![Step_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205275740-de1041a6-6719-4dc4-9481-61ce0f777e92.png)


Step3. Click `Browse` and change hard drive to D, click `next`:

![Step_3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205272730-294b52f3-4a6a-4d31-8453-f54226f7cf53.png)

Step4. Click `Next` on Start Menu Folder:

![Step_4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205272980-06754966-b83d-4736-94ad-3d01c19ccbf6.png)

Step5. Click `Next` on Select Aditional Tasks:

![Step_5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205273144-6eb7875c-e13d-4623-93d8-9bfe818bfe0c.png)

Step6. Click `Install` on Ready to Install:

![Step_6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205273291-12ec20ed-d0be-4ebd-a92d-935e7a6eec6c.png)

Step7. Click `Finish` with default checkbox Launch Status selected and wait Status Desktop to run.

![Step_7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205273503-6b0c9bb4-93f0-4ba5-a144-1e6cb35d8b35.png)

Step8. Mark both checkboxes in "Before you get started..." and click `Get Started`.

![Step_8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205273959-f93b0c83-a6d0-446b-a4d2-bbff7590a685.png)

Step9. Click on `I am new to Status`.

![Step_9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205274143-de3feacb-38fa-43b4-92e1-10e194ab3b78.png)

Step10. Click on `Generate new keys`

![Step_10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205274282-132ce3ff-5c88-4d2e-92a7-6c02f6994414.png)

Step11. Set my name and put my picture, then click on `Next`.

![Step_11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205274462-bd93cccb-8d88-4b2b-8f1c-33822189441f.png)

Step12. Click on `Next`.

![Step_12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205274587-3e4e97d4-ee7c-47aa-9c07-e04de2110958.png)

Step13. Generate a password with my password manager (Bitwarden), click on button "Copy Password", and set that password in Status Desktop with ctrl+v. This password is length 18 characters, it has Upper and Lower case letters, Numbers and Symbols. Click on `Create Password`.

![Step_13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205274939-19fb0bac-f501-466c-9567-d3994e0fa63a.png)

Step14. Paste the password again with ctrl+v. *Somehow the clipboard is empty*. Have to copy again the password. Then click on `Finalise Status Password Creation`. The error pops up.

![Step_14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23367096/205275483-45446a40-821b-456c-b9ae-ceb81d6e533f.png)

Now if I click on ok and I click again on `Finalise Status Password Creation`, nothing happens.

#### Expected behavior

Going to the next step in the set up phase.

#### Actual behavior

Error. Can not continue.

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: StatusIm-Desktop-v0.8.0-7be712
- Operating System: Microsoft Windows 11 Pro, 10.0.22621 Build 22621

The problem was that the Waku port was already in use.

Status wasn't already opened (no zombies), so we're not sure what was clashing. Might have been a sad accident.

Anyway, by setting the `WAKUV2_PORT` env var, we were able to remediate the issue.
